definition: To modify or change something in a diverse or alternating manner, often referring to adjusting or altering elements, characteristics, or aspects of a particular subject. It is commonly employed when discussing the adjustment of variables, parameters, or options to achieve different outcomes or results.

examples.german: Die Ergebnisse variieren je nach Standort.
examples.english: The results vary depending on the location.

examples.german: Die Farben variieren von hell bis dunkel.
examples.english: The colors vary from light to dark.

examples.german: Die Meinungen der Experten variieren stark.
examples.english: The opinions of the experts vary greatly.

examples.german: Die Größe des Hauses kann variieren.
examples.english: The size of the house can vary.
